meanings.definition: A storm with a violent wind, in particular a tropical cyclone in the Caribbean.
meanings.sent1: Hurricanes can cause a lot of damage to houses and trees.
meanings.sent2: People in coastal areas prepare for hurricanes by boarding up windows.
meanings.sent3: The hurricanes outside were so loud, they almost sounded like a group of howling wolves.
meanings.sent4: The force of the hurricanes was like a giant invisible hand pushing everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The sight of hurricanes swirling in the distance was both terrifying and mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: A violent windstorm, especially one with rain.
meanings.sent1: During hurricanes, it's important to stay indoors to stay safe.
meanings.sent2: The sound of hurricanes roaring outside kept everyone awake all night.
meanings.sent3: The hurricanes seemed to be playing a wild game of tag with the clouds.
meanings.sent4: The force of the hurricanes felt like nature's angry fists pounding on the earth.
meanings.sent5: The memory of hurricanes ripping through the town haunted the survivors for years to come.
